parameters.therm_bmp: the respondent's thermometer rating of "both major parties"
parameters.govt_biginterests:
the respondent's assessment of whether the government is run by a few big interests. 0 = Run for the benefit of all people.
1 = Run by a few big interests.
parameters.urbanism: 1 = central cities. 2 = suburban areas. 3 = rural/small towns/outlying areas.
parameters.race4: respondent's race-ethnicity summary. 1 = White, non-hispanic. 2 = Black, non-hispanic. 3 = Hispanic. 4 = Other.
parameters.therm_dem: the respondent's thermometer rating of the Democratic party
parameters.stateabb: the two-character abbreviation for the state of residence for the respondent
parameters.pid7:
1 = Strong Democrat. 2 = Weak Democrat. 3 = Independent, lean Democrat. 4 = Independent. 5 = Independent, lean Republican.
6 = Weak Republican. 7 = Strong Republican
parameters.govt_crooked: the respondent's assessment of how many government officials are crooked. 1 = Hardly any. 2 = Not many. 3 = Quite a few; quite a lot.
parameters.uid: a unique identifier for each respondent, taken directly from the time-series files for potential merging
parameters.therm_gop: the respondent's thermometer rating of the Republican party
parameters.govt_waste: the respondent's assessment of how much the government wastes in tax money. 1 = Not very much. 2 = Some. 3 = A lot.
parameters.unemployed: a binary numeric vector for if the respondent is temporarily unemployed.
parameters.distrust_govt:
the respondent's self-reported (dis)trust in the federal government's ability to do what's right. 1 = Just about always (trust the government).
2 = Most of the time. 3 = Some of the time. 4 = None of the time/never.
parameters.educat:
the education-level of the respondent. 1 = 8 grades or less.
2 = high school, no diploma. 3 = high school diploma. 4 = high school "plus non-academic training".
5 = Some college, no degree (includes AA holders). 6 = BA-level degree. 7 = advanced degree, including Bachelor of Laws degrees.
parameters.polint: the respondent's self-reported interest in public affairs. 1 = Hardly at all. 2 = Only now and then. 3 = Some of the time. 4 = Most of the time.
parameters.mpti: the "major party thermometer index" score for the respondent. See details for more.

reference:
The major party thermometer index is calculated as the thermometer rating for the
Democratic party minus the thermometer rating for the Republican party. 100 is then added to that difference, which is then divided by 2.
Fractional results are rounded to the next highest integer. Also note the coding of the "government distrust" measures. These are reverse-coded
from their original scales.
title: Major Party (Democrat, Republican) Thermometer Index Data (1978-2012)
description:
Description
A data set on thermometer ratings for the Democratic party, Republican party,
"both major parties", and a major party thermometer index from the
American National Election Studies (1978-2012).
format: A data frame with 33830 observations on the following 19 variables.
